text: Quick JSON question.  I’m trying to put callouts inside my MONSTER themes.json file.  Is there a way to do this within a { }??

Comments aren’t part of JSON spec :confused: , you might be able to get away with putting keys on stuff like `"_MYCOMMENT": "This is my super cool comment"` , but I’m not sure if our backend validation would be alright with that. /cc <@U6W3H6YN8>
Out of cursitory, what sort of comments are you wanting to add <@UA5DFM7CK>?

<@U6W3H6YN8> This is a bit of an exaggerated comment block, but I’d love to put in a noticable section so that with a scroll I (or another developer) can easily spot the different sections of the theme file.

<@UA886MF42> thanks for the tip. I figured it would break validation so I didn’t even attempt your method.  I’m actually hoping for something that stands out a bit more.  Every language has it’s specific way to commenting out something, so I wasn’t sure if Json had one other than //
